intro: Gynochthodes suratmanii, commonly known as the Suratmanii orchid, is a rare and unusual plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a short, stocky rhizome and a single, erect stem that bears a single, showy, greenish-white flower. The plant is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the rainforests of Indonesia. Due to its restricted habitat and low population numbers, it is considered endangered and is often found in very specific microhabitats. Its botanical significance lies in its distinctive floral structure and its role in the ecological diversity of its native environment.
